content.text: B.	Proposed post and non-post resource requirements for 2026

children.text: Overview
(a)		Travel of representatives of Member States that are least developed countries
The proposed regular budget resources for 2026, including the breakdown of resource changes, as applicable, are reflected in table 1.5.
Evolution of financial resources by object of expenditure
(Thousands of United States dollars)
The overall resources proposed for 2026 amount to $1,599,300, reflecting no change compared with the approved budget for 2025.

Information on the advance booking for air travel is reflected in table 1.6. The Office will continue its efforts to ensure the advance booking of tickets in line with the air travel policy and improve its compliance rate.
(Thousands of United States dollars)
Additional details on the distribution of the proposed resources for 2026 are reflected in table 1.8 and figure 1.I.

As shown in tables 1.7 and 1.8 (1), the overall resources proposed for 2026 amount to $264,400, reflecting no change compared with the approved budget for 2025. The proposed level of resources provides for the full, efficient and effective implementation of mandates.
(Thousands of United States dollars)
The overall resources proposed for 2026 amount to $2,578,200, reflecting no change compared with the approved budget for 2025.
Compliance rate
(Percentage)

table_content.text: Air tickets purchased at least  two weeks before the commencement of travel

children.text: (b)		Presidents of the General Assembly
The proposed regular budget resources for 2026, including the breakdown of resource changes, as applicable, are reflected in table 1.7.
(Percentage)

table_content.text: Air tickets purchased at least two weeks before the commencement of travel

children.text: (c)	Department for General Assembly and Conference Management backstopping of the Presidents of the General Assembly

Evolution of financial resources by object of expenditure
(Thousands of United States dollars)
The overall resources proposed for 2026 amount to $1,599,300, reflecting no change compared with the approved budget for 2025.

Information on the advance booking for air travel is reflected in table 1.6. The Office will continue its efforts to ensure the advance booking of tickets in line with the air travel policy and improve its compliance rate.
(Thousands of United States dollars)
Additional details on the distribution of the proposed resources for 2026 are reflected in table 1.8 and figure 1.I.

As shown in tables 1.7 and 1.8 (1), the overall resources proposed for 2026 amount to $264,400, reflecting no change compared with the approved budget for 2025. The proposed level of resources provides for the full, efficient and effective implementation of mandates.
(Thousands of United States dollars)
The overall resources proposed for 2026 amount to $2,578,200, reflecting no change compared with the approved budget for 2025.
Evolution of financial resources by source of funding and component
(Thousands of United States dollars)
(1)	Regular budget
(2)	Extrabudgetary
Distribution of proposed resources for 2026
(Thousands of United States dollars)
Extrabudgetary resources

As reflected in table 1.8 (2), extrabudgetary resources amount to $2,867,800. The non-post resources would complement regular budget resources and would be used mainly to complement the programme of work and facilitate funding for a broad range of projects and activities implemented by the office, at the discretion of the Presidents of the General Assembly.

The extrabudgetary resources under the present section are subject to the oversight of the Department for General Assembly and Conference Management, which has delegated authority from the Secretary-General.

Information on the advance booking for air travel is reflected in table 1.9. The Office will critically reassess its efforts to ensure the advance booking of tickets in line with the air travel policy and improve its compliance rate.
Compliance rate
(Percentage)

table_content.text: Air tickets purchased at least  two weeks before the commencement of travel
